basic_info.name: Skoda Octavia RS
basic_info.description: Skoda Octavia RS is a 5-seater Sedan available at a starting price of Rs. 49.99 Lakh. The car is available in 1 variants, with 1 engine and 1 transmission option. Additionally, Octavia RS offers a Ground Clearance measurement of 128 mm and a Boot capacity of 600 liters. You can choose from 5 colors for the Octavia RS.

Introduction: Skoda Auto India officially launched the new Octavia RS on October 17, 2025 at Rs. 49.99 lakh (ex-showroom).
However, this price was for the first 100 units which got instantly sold out.
The Octavia RS is a high-performance version of the standard sedan, marking the return of the RS variant to India.
It is offered in a single variant, five colours, and with a single engine and transmission option.
Deliveries of the first lot were scheduled to begin on 6 November and later slots not confirmed.
The original RS variant of the Octavia was discontinued in April 2023 due to new BS6 Phase 2 emission standards.
Currently in its fourth generation, the Octavia RS is offered in India as a Completely Built Unit (CBU).
Exterior: Prospective buyers can opt for the 2025 Skoda Octavia RS in five colours such as Race Blue, Velvet Red, Candy White, Magic Black, and the signature Mamba Green.
The RS differentiates itself from the standard Octavia with subtle tweaks and different badging.
For example, the bright Mamba Green is exclusively for the RS, while a special RS badge adorns the front grille and tailgate.
The bumpers look sportier and given the RS suffix, this version of the Octavia rides 15mm lower than the standard Octavia.
Moreover, the sports sedan features a sports exhaust system with black tailpipes as standard.
Other exterior highlights include all-LED lights, 19-inch dual-tone alloys, dynamic turn indicators, and red brake calipers.
Interior: The Skoda Octavia RS also boasts an impressive feature list, with a 12.9-inch touchscreen, 360-degree camera, three-zone climate control, and a 10.25-inch instrument cluster.
The front sport seats offer massage, heating, cooling, and memory functions.
Notably, the India-spec model lacks Dynamic Chassis Control (DCC) and a sunroof.
However, Skoda has equipped it with an electronic limited-slip differential on the front axle.
Powertrain: Under the hood of the new Octavia RS is a 2.0-litre, TSI petrol engine.It comes mated to a seven-speed DCT automatic gearbox with no manual option.
This mill is tuned to produce 261bhp and 370Nm of torque.Interestingly, it lends the car a 0-100kmph sprint time of just above six seconds.
